00059         /*
00060          * epi_statistics: Epi model statistics structure
00061          *
00062          * s_move_ev    -- how many times did we get a move event?
00063          * s_nchecked   -- number of agents checked by seir
00064          * s_ndraws     -- total draws from random uniform distribution
00065          * s_ninfected  -- number of agents who have become infected
00066          */
00067 DEF(struct, epi_statistics)
00068 {
00069         //unsigned long int     s_move_ev;
00070         //unsigned long int     s_nchecked;
00071         //unsigned long int     s_ndraws;
00072         unsigned long int       s_ninfected;
00073         unsigned long int       s_ndead;
00074 };
00075 
00076         /*
00077          * epi_state    -- the location LP state
00078          *
00079          * grid_type    -- type of this location: HOME, WORK, etc
00080          * pq           -- priority queue pointer to global location PQ
00081          * stats        -- per LP statistics collection structure
00082          * ncontagious  -- number of symptomatic agents at this location
00083          * last_event   -- last time that an seir check was performed
00084          */
00085 
00086         /*
00087          * NOTE: The issue is that we can use different types of PQ's, and since we
00088          * do not have iterators defined, we cannot walk the unknown data structure impl.
00089          */
00090 DEF(struct, epi_state)
00091 {
00092         //epi_grid_t     grid_type;
00093         void            *pq;
00094         tw_event        *tmr_remove;
00095         tw_stime         last_event;
00096         unsigned int     max_queue_size;
00097         unsigned int     ncontagious;
00098         epi_statistics  *stats;
00099 };
00100 
00101         /*
00102          * epi_ic_stage describes a stage in the illness.  Normal
00103          * progression goes from Susceptible (non-infected) to
00104          * infected (incubating), to infected (symptomatic), to
00105          * recovered (immune).
00106          *
00107          * ln_multiplier is used for the random draw from geometric
00108          * distribution.
00109          */
00110 DEF(struct, epi_ic_stage)
00111 {
00112         unsigned int     stage_index;
00113         char            *stage_name;
00114         double           start_multiplier,
00115                          stop_multiplier;
00116         double           ln_multiplier;
00117         double           min_duration,
00118                          max_duration;
00119         double           mortality_rate;
00120         int              eligible_for_inoculation,
00121                          progress_trumps_inoculation,
00122                          hospital_treatment,
00123                          is_symptomatic;
00124         double           days_in_hospital;
00125 };
00126 
00127         /*
00128          * epi_stage_t:  enumeration of the stages of disease 
00129          * not used by code - stages are input
00130          */
00131 DEF(enum, epi_stage_t)
00132 {
00133         EPI_SUSCEPTIBLE = 0,
00134         EPI_INCUBATING,
00135         EPI_SYMPTOMATIC,
00136         EPI_IMMUNE,
00137         EPI_DECEASED
00138 };

00172         /*
00173          * epi_egent: representation of a person in the model
00174          *
00175          * next         -- pointer used by LPs to build priority queue container of agents
00176          * prev         -- pointer used by LPs to build priority queue container of agents
00177          * up           -- pointer used by LPs to build priority queue container of agents
00178          * ts_remove    -- time the agent will remove itself from location LP
00179          * ts_next      -- minimum of ts_remove and ts_stage_tran, used for queuing
00180          * a_type       -- the type of person represented
00181          * stage        -- disease stage
00182          * ts_stage_tran - transition time to next stage 
00183          * ts_last_tran -- time of last transition (i.e. to current stage)
00184          * ts_infected  -- time agent caught disease (became infected)
00185          * n_infected   -- number of other agents infected by this agent
00186          * behavior_flags  boolean bit flags for behaviors
00187          *      1 - worried well
00188          *      2 - goes to work (school) when sick
00189          *      4 - 
00190          * days_remaining  number of days before going back to work
00191          * curr         -- the current position in the location vector
00192          * nloc         -- the size of the location vector
00193          * loc          -- the location vector
00194          */
00195 DEF(struct, epi_agent)
00196 {
00197         /* these 4 vars are need for PQ */
00198         epi_agent       *volatile next;
00199         epi_agent       *volatile prev;
00200         //epi_agent     *volatile up;
00201         int              heap_index;
00202 
00203         tw_stime         ts_remove;
00204         tw_stime         ts_next;
00205 
00206         //epi_agent_t    a_type;
00207         epi_stage_t      stage;
00208 
00209         tw_stime         ts_stage_tran;
00210         //tw_stime       ts_last_tran;
00211 
00212         //tw_stime       ts_infected;
00213         //unsigned int   n_infected;
00214 
00215         epi_agent_behavior_t     behavior_flags;
00216         int              days_remaining;
00217 
00218         //unsigned int   id;
00219         int              curr;
00220         unsigned int     nloc;
00221         int             *loc;
00222         tw_stime        *dur;
00223 
00224         // the NUM we are connected to
00225         tw_lpid          num;
00226 
00227         // Census Tract we are in
00228         unsigned int     ct;
00229 };
